title: Bug 6322: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: The All Types dialog in JDK 1.4 is displaying obfuscated classes such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', and 'd'. This is not expected behavior.
OB: When opening the All Types dialog in JDK 1.4, obfuscated class names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', and 'd' are displayed.
EB: The All Types dialog should only display non-obfuscated classes and should not include class names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', and 'd'.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Launch JDK 1.4. 2. Open the All Types dialog. 3. Observe the presence of obfuscated class names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', and 'd'.
